member.summary: Represents a multi month calendar with an ability to interactively navigate through months and select a specific value or its components.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.GenerateAdjacentMonthDaysProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.GenerateAdjacentMonthDays
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to show days corresponding to months which are adjacent for the months currently represented by the control. The default value is False. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: If is set to true, the property for the showing a first of currently represented months and the property for the showing a last of currently represented months are set to true.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.ShowWeekNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control displays week numbers (1-52). This is a dependency property. The default is false.
member.remarks: The actual appearance of week numbers is determined in the control template with the control instance. To show week numbers in the custom control template, place the control into template visual tree and bind it's Visibility property to the property.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.ShowWeekNumbersProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthCountProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a number of months currently represented by the calendar. The default value is 1. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: A default UI of the control is designed so as to fit as many child controls as can fit in the current control size, taking into account the size of each single month calendar which is determined by the and properties. As a result, when control is resized, a value of the property is changed automatically.
You can change default behavior by using custom ItemsPanelTemplate. For more details see property description.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthSlotStyle

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthsPanelProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Calendar.MonthsPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets an ItemsPanelTemplate that defines the panel that lays out elements representing separate months. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para:
C1Calendar controls supports the next panels:
The panel. This is a default setting. A value of the property is set automatically according to the available space.
The panel. A value of the property is set automatically according to the grid definition.
The panel. The control honors explicitly defined property value.
The panel. The control honors explicitly defined property value. <c1sched:C1Calendar MonthCount="4"> <c1sched:C1Calendar.MonthsPanel> <ItemsPanelTemplate> <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal"/> </ItemsPanelTemplate> </c1sched:C1Calendar.MonthsPanel> </c1sched:C1Calendar>

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.ShiftingCanvas
member.summary: Positions children elements in the viewport of the parent ScrollViewer control which supports horizontal scrolling.
member.remarks: If some part of the ShiftingCanvas is scrolled out of the view, children elements are moved according to the scroll position. Depending on the property value children are aligned to the left-most or the right-most viewport side. HorizontalContentAlignment.Center and HorizontalContentAlignment.Stretch are not supported.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.ShiftingCanvas.HorizontalContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the control's content. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: HorizontalContentAlignment.Center and HorizontalContentAlignment.Stretch are not supported.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1CalendarResources
member.summary: The keeps the set of resources used by the derived controls. Static fields of this class return default CalendarBase's themes.
member.remarks:
Resource lookup behavior:
If Theme property is set to something other than Classic System Colors theme, the lookup process checks for the requested key within the resource dictionary defined by the current control theme
The lookup process checks resources in a usual way (in page, window or application resources)
The lookup process checks resources in default theme dictionary.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.CalendarBase
member.summary: The base class for the and controls.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.CalendarBase.DefaultThemeKey
member.summary: Gets the that references the default theme that is defined for the calendar control.
member.remarks:
You can use this read-only static field in XAML by assigning its static value to another property value. Specifically, this field's value defines the that is used to look up the default theme. To redefine this theme, reference the by using the x:Static Markup Extension and assign that value as the x:Key Attribute of the new object. You can use this field in XAML as an x:Key Attribute of a that redefines the theme for the calendar control.
<Application.Resources> <ResourceDictionary> <ResourceDictionary x:Key="{x:Static c1sched:CalendarBase.DefaultThemeKey}" Source="/C1.WPF.Schedule.4.5.2;component/themes/CalendarThemes/Office2007/Blue.xaml" /> </ResourceDictionary> </Application.Resources>

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.DaySlot
member.summary: Represents a day slot in the control.
member.remarks: An instance of this class can represent a day of a month or an empty slot, which is determined by the property value. In the case when is empty, the property will have a null value, but the other properties will still contain information that allows you to determine the placement of the slot in the calendar. For example the property will determine a day of week that the slot corresponds to.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SelectedDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a DateTime currently selected in control UI. The default value is . This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: This property value is related to a from the VisualIntervals collection that is currently selected in control UI. If this property is set to a value that is beyond a currently represented period of time defined by the and properties, the value of the property is changed automatically so as to set up a period of time that includes the new property value.
You can use this property to bind the control to external controls that provides DateTime navigation, for example, bind it to the SelectedDateTime property of the C1Calendar control.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SelectedDateTimeInterval
member.summary: Gets the object representing time interval which is currently selected in the control UI. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SelectedIntervalAppointment
member.summary: Gets or sets a that is currently selected in control UI. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SelectedAppointment
member.summary: Gets or sets an that is currently selected in the control UI. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisualStartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a start of a period of time that is currently represented in the control UI. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
Usually this property value should not be set directly; it gets its value automatically based on the and properties (the latter one has DateTime.Today as default) so as to be aligned at the beginning of a current week or current month's first week. Setting it to a value that is not correctly aligned relative to the current control UI (for example, if it is not set to the first day of the week for the Month view) can cause an inadequate UI look.
To change a current period of time safely you can use the property or the method or the command.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisibleDates
member.summary: Gets the list of currently visible dates. Changing this list might affect the next properties:

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisualTimeSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets a length of a period of time that is currently represented in the control UI. The start of the period is defined by the property. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisualEndTime
member.summary: Gets an end of a period of time that is currently represented in the control UI. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: This property value is calculated as a sum of the and property values.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisualIntervalScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a TimeSpan of each in the VisualIntervals collection. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: The C1Scheduler control resets this property at applying new style, so that style property setters always have effect. To preserve time scale for views with short time intervals, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SmallVisualIntervalScale
member.summary: If this property value is set, defines TimeSpan of each in the VisualIntervals collection for views with intervals shorther than 1 day. This is a dependency property. The default value is TimeSpan.Zero which means that only property has effect.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets a DateTime that defines a beginning of an overall period of time that can be represented by the control. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisualIntervalGroupDescriptions
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of objects that defines a grouping criteria applied to the items of the VisualIntervals collection. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
This property is usually used for the purpose of control UI creation in XAML. The defined grouping criteria is applied to the VisualIntervals collection items and is reflected in the VisualIntervalsView view, which exposes grouped items via the Groups property.
This property is used in a conjunction with the property that defines UI for each group level.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.SetRelativeStartTime(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the property to a value between the and property values based on the specified coefficient.
member.param: A double value in a range between 0 and 1 that defines a relative value between and .
member.remarks:
The approximate new value is calculated with the following formula:
VisualStartTime = Start + (End - Start) * coefficient
After the new value is calculated, it is adjusted so that the old and new values of the property become different in an amount that is multiple of the property value, that guarantees that the first in the VisualIntervals collection is properly aligned to be in synch with UI model suppositions.
This method implements the command.

the whose will be edited.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.DataSourceItemSynchronized
member.summary: Occurs when changes made to one of the collections (for example, to ) has been fully reflected in the storage underlying data source.
member.remarks:
If properties of an item of the collection are changed between BeginEdit and EndEdit calls performed on the item, this event will not be raised until the EndEdit method will be called.
Use this event if you want to update a back store of your data source only after the changes to a corresponding collection have been fully completed. For example, if you use ADO.NET DataSet as a data source, you can commit the changes made in a DataRow as a result of changes in the collection item to the underlying database.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.UserEditingAppointment
member.summary: Occurs before the Edit Appointment dialog appears on the screen for editing of an existing appointment, as a result of a double-click on the appointment in one of the default control views, the method call, or when an command is received.
member.remarks:
Use this event to make custom settings to an editing appointment before it appears on the screen and/or to implement your own reaction on this event, instead of activating a standard dialog window.
In order to change appointment properties before showing the dialog on a screen, use the appointment object referenced by the e.Appointment event argument.
To prevent activating a standard dialog window, set the e.Handled event argument to True.

member.summary: Raises a UserEditingAppointment event.

a double-click on the control area in one of the default control views,
the NewAppointmentDialog method call,
a command.
member.remarks:
Use this event to make custom settings to a new appointment before it appears on the screen and/or to implement your own reaction on this event, instead of activating a standard dialog window.
In order to change appointment properties before showing the dialog on a screen, use the appointment object referenced by the e.Appointment event argument.
To prevent activating a standard dialog window, set the e.Handled event argument to True.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.GroupBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the type of grouping.
member.value: The default value is an empty string.

remarks.para:
This property can be equal to one for the next supported keywords:
An empty stringno grouping.
"Owner"grouping by Appointment.Owner property value.
"Category"grouping by Appointment.Categories property value.
"Contact"grouping by Appointment.Links property value.
"Resource"grouping by Appointment.Resources property value.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.ShowEmptyGroupItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining whether the control should display an empty group item.
member.remarks: This property only makes sense when the property is set. If this property is set to True, the control will display a group item without assigned owner (resource, contact or category). This group item will contain all appointments, which don't fall into other group items.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.GroupItems
member.summary: Gets a collection of all available objects for the currently set type of grouping.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.VisibleGroupItems
member.summary: Gets a collection of currently visible objects. This collection can be used in xaml in the control templates.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.TotalGroupItem
member.summary: Gets the object representing the group item which has no owner, but contains appointments of all visible group items.
member.remarks: It is a special group item, it is not included into GroupItems and VisibleGroupItems collections. The control uses this group to display availability status line in the default TimeLineStyle (see source xaml for the sample of using).

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.DefaultThemeKey
member.summary: Gets the that references the default theme that is defined for the control.
member.remarks:
You can use this read-only static field in XAML by assigning its value to another property value. Specifically, this field's value defines the that is used to look up the default theme. To redefine this theme, reference the by using the x:Static Markup Extension and assign that value as the x:Key Attribute of the new object. You can use this field in XAML as an x:Key Attribute of a that redefines the theme for the control.
<Application.Resources> <ResourceDictionary> <ResourceDictionary x:Key="{x:Static c1sched:C1Scheduler.DefaultThemeKey}" Source="/C1.WPF.Schedule.4.5.2;component/themes/SchedulerThemes/Office2007/Silver.xaml" /> </ResourceDictionary> </Application.Resources>

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1Scheduler.IntervalAppointmentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTemplate that defines a UI representation of an object. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: A single appointment can be represented by multiple elements in control's view. For example, in the Months view the appointment that hit two weeks will be represented by two separate elements, a different element for each week. Because of this, a DataContext for the appointment template is a object (but not an object), which represents the chunk of appointment covering a specific period of time that can be shown by a single UI element.

member.summary: Determines whether control should display embedded reminder dialog when reminder is fired.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.AllowContactsEditing
member.summary: Determines whether end-user has permission to edit Contacts.
member.remarks: If this property is false, default dialogs will only allow selection from the existing items. If this property is false and ContactCollection is empty, default Appointment dialog won't show controls for editing Contacts.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.AllowContactsMultiSelection
member.summary: Determines whether multiple Contact objects might be assigned to the single Appointment object.

remarks.para: If both and properties are false, the default Appointment dialog will show ComboBox for selecting single Contact object.
If this property is true, the default Appointment dialog will allow selecting multiple contacts in a separate dialog.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.AllowResourcesEditing
member.summary: Determines whether end-user has permission to edit Resources.
member.remarks: If this property is false, default dialogs will only allow selection from the existing items. If this property is false and ResourceCollection is empty, default Appointment dialog won't show controls for editing Resources.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.AllowResourcesMultiSelection
member.summary: Determines whether multiple Resource objects might be assigned to the single Appointment object.

remarks.para: If both and properties are false, the default Appointment dialog will show ComboBox for selecting single Resource object.
If this property is true, the default Appointment dialog will allow selecting multiple resources in a separate dialog.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.AllowCategoriesEditing
member.summary: Determines whether end-user has permission to edit Categories.
member.remarks: If this property is false, default dialogs will only allow selection from the existing items. If this property is false and CategoryCollection is empty, default Appointment dialog won't show controls for editing Categories.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.AllowCategoriesMultiSelection
member.summary: Determines whether multiple Category objects might be assigned to the single Appointment object.

remarks.para: If both and properties are false, the default Appointment dialog will show ComboBox for selecting single Category object.
If this property is true, the default Appointment dialog will allow selecting multiple categories in a separate dialog.

member.remarks: This property affects only initial scroll position.

member.remarks: This property only affects initial setting. End-user will be able to change reminder settings for every individual object.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.C1SchedulerSettings.ReminderTimeBeforeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value which should be used as initial value for the property. The default value is 15 minutes.
member.remarks: You should honor this property if you create appointments from code.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply time slot group styles for working/free hours in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyleBase in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector x:Key="TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_WorkHour_Style" for work hours;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_FreeHour_Style" for free hours.
Specify style selector in the group definition:
<GroupStyle ContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector}">

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Schedule.TimeSlotGroupStyleSelector.SelectStyle(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the object for the specified group if it is found in resources.
member.param: The content.
The element to which the style will be applied.
member.returns: Returns an application-specific style to apply; otherwise, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.DayGroupStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply day group styles in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyle in themes/SchedulerThemes/Office2007/Blue.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:DayGroupStyleSelector x:Key="DayGroupStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_Day_Style" for ordinal day style;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_Today_Style" for the current day style.
Specify style selector in the group definition:
<GroupStyle ContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource DayGroupStyleSelector}"/>

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Schedule.DayGroupStyleSelector.SelectStyle(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the object for the specified group if it is found in resources.
member.param: The content.
The element to which the style will be applied.
member.returns: Returns an application-specific style to apply; otherwise, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.TimeSlotTemplateSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to choose a DataTemplate for the object representing the single time slot in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyleBase in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:TimeSlotTemplateSelector x:Key="TimeSlotTemplateSelector"/>
Define two DataTemplates:
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_FreeSlot_Template" for free time;
with the key "PART_C1Scheduler_WorkSlot_Template" for working time.
Specify ItemsControl.ItemTemplateSelector for the object:
<local:C1SchedulerPresenter ItemTemplateSelector="{StaticResource TimeSlotTemplateSelector}" /> Note, that if you use this method for choosing VisualInterval DataTemplate, you shouldn't set property.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Schedule.TimeSlotTemplateSelector.SelectTemplate(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the object for the specified group if it is found in resources.
member.param: The data object for which to select the template.
The data-bound object.
member.returns: Returns a DataTemplate or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.DayIntervalStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply day group styles for ordinal/current days.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyleBase in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:DayIntervalStyleSelector x:Key="DayIntervalStyleSelector"/>
Define two group styles:
with the key "C1Scheduler_Day_Style" for ordinal days;
with the key "C1Scheduler_Today_Style" for the current day.
Specify style selector in the group definition:
<GroupStyle ContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource DayIntervalStyleSelector}">

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.TimeSlotStyleSelector
member.summary: This class provides a way to apply time slot styles for working/free hours in DayView/WorkWeekView modes.
member.remarks:
For the sample of using look at OneDayStyle in generic.xaml.
Create an instance of this class:
<local:TimeSlotStyleSelector x:Key="TimeSlotStyleSelector"/>
Define two styles:
with the key "C1Scheduler_WorkSlot_Style" for work hours;
with the key "C1Scheduler_FreeSlot_Style" for free hours.
Define two optional styles:
with the key "C1Scheduler_TopWorkSlot_Style" for the top slot in every work hour;
with the key "C1Scheduler_TopFreeSlot_Style" for the top slot in every free hour.
Specify ItemContainerStyleSelector property for the object:
<local:C1SchedulerPresenter ItemContainerStyleSelector="{StaticResource TimeSlotTemplateSelector}" />

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.AppointmentWrapPanel
member.summary: Positions child elements in sequential position from left to right, breaking content to the next line at the edge of the containing box. Subsequent ordering happens sequentially from top to bottom or from right to left, depending on the value of the property. If property is this panel behaves as the base class. If property is then tries to position child elements in available space. For example, it doesn't wrap the child to the next line if the next line invisible. Instead, it shows as much as possible in the last visible line. When user clicks on the panel it tries to find and focus child element with x:Name="PART_Subject". It is used for switching appointment element into in-place editing mode.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid
member.summary: Represents a grid panel that automatically distributes child elements among grid cells.

remarks.para: The class provides the following additional functionality to the base Grid class.

item.description: Scatters child elements by rows or columns depending on the property value, with an ability to change a default placement for any child element by specifying the objects in the collection.

Introduces the settable and bindable and properties that allows defining of row and column count numerically, without adding/removing items in the Grid.RowDefinitions/ColumnDefinitions collections. Along with the introduced bindable property it gives, for example, an ability to have as many rows as you have children.
Gives an ability to automatically keeps a number of column and rows so as cells with a fixed width and/or height fully fit in the size. This is controlled by the and properties.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.ChildrenFlowDirectionProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.ChildrenFlowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines a flow direction of child elements in the . The default value is . This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: If is set to , child elements are distributed row by row, that is a first grid row is filled first (in the left to right direction), then the second row, and so on.
If is set to , child elements are distributed column by column, that is a first grid column is filled first (in the top to bottom direction), then the second column, and so on.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.RowCountProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.RowCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines a number of rows in the . This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
Use this property to specify a number of grid rows numerically.
This property value is being kept in sync with a number of items in the collection.
If a number of items in the collection has been changed then the value of the property is updated automatically.
If a value of the property is changed directly, then items will be added or removed to/from the end of collection until its number becomes equal to the new value.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.ColumnCountProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines a number of columns in the . This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
Use this property to specify a number of grid columns numerically.
This property value is being kept in sync with a number of items in the collection.
If a number of items in the collection has been changed then the value of the property is updated automatically.
If a value of the property is changed directly, then items will be added or removed to/from the end of collection until its number becomes equal to the new value.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.summary: Gets a number of child elements of the . This is a dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.AutoDistributionGrid.FitCellsOfHeight
member.summary: Allows the forcing of the to generate cells of the specified height, where a number of rows will be automatically adjusted so as to fully fit a maximum number of cells in a current grid height. The default value is . This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: Setting to non Double.NaN value directs grid to automatically create as many columns of the height specified as the property value that can fully fit in the grid's height (but at least one). When grid height is changed, the number of rows is adjusted automatically.

remarks.para: Setting to non Double.NaN value directs grid to automatically create as many columns of the width specified as the property value that can fully fit in the grid's width (but at least one). When grid width is being changed the number of columns is adjusted automatically.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfoCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo
member.summary: Describes a non-default placement for a child element of the .
member.remarks: Use instances of the class as items of the collection to change a default placement of a certain child element. Each object of the collection instructs the grid that a child object at index should be (optionally) placed to a cell with and indexes and also has and spans. If the position is redefined for a certain element in such a way, then the next element will be placed in a cell next to this element according to the specified. If a span is defined and the span direction conforms to the Orientation specified in the property, then the next element will skip over the span. Each item's info can be propagated to a number (fixed or infinite) of next elements, which is specified in the property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo.ElementIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets an index of a child element in the child elements collection of the grid whose distribution info is defined by this object.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo.Row
member.summary: Gets or sets a row number where the element described by the will be placed.
member.remarks: The default value is Null, which means that a default row position is not changed. Setting it to a non-null value forces to place the child element in the specified row position.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo.Column
member.summary: Gets or sets a column number where the element described by the will be placed.
member.remarks: The default value is Null, which means that a default column position is not changed. Setting it to a non-null value forces to place the child element in the specified column position.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo.RowSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets a number of rows spanned by a child element. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo.ColumnSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets a number of columns spanned by a child element. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.DistributionInfo.Propagate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines a number of child elements whose placement is described by the . The default value is 0, which means no propagation.
member.remarks: defines a number of elements with indexes started at + 1 that will get a distribution info which is defined in this object. A negative value indicates that all elements that follows the element at index will be provided with this distribution info. A propagation is stopped at a first element that has a corresponding object defined.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.AppointmentsCoverPane
member.summary: Provides a surface for painting appointment boxes over an arbitrary visual intervals layout.
member.remarks:
allows you to visually represent a set of appointments that fit in a time range exposed by a current view, and to draw appointment boxes relative to UI elements representing s covered by the appointment. The element, being placed somewhere inside visual tree (usually in C1Scheduler's ControlTemplate), provides a surface where it draws appointment boxes relative to UI elements representing VisualIntervals. AppointmentsCoverPane is capable to recognize the case when the appointment box must be divided into two or more visual boxes, for example, if appointment covers three days in the Working Week View, AppointmentsCoverPane will automatically draw three boxes for the appointment, each box in a corresponding day column, with starting and ending edges positioned at interval UI elements corresponding to start and end time of the appointment in this day.
AppointmentsCoverPane provides this functionality for an arbitrary UI representing s. To make it possible, each element that can be treated as VisualInterval UI representative (usually it's an outer (root) element in the definition) must have the attached assigned ( is the base class for ). The assigned value indicates a chronological flow direction of interval elements and can take Horizontal or Vertical values. For example, interval elements in the Working Week View have it assigned to Vertical, while elements of Month View assign it to Horizontal. A content of an appointment box of AppointmentsCoverPane is represented by DataTemplate defined in the property.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.AppointmentsCoverPane.AppointmentFilterProperty
member.summary: The AppointmentFilter attached property can be used to specify which type of appointments should be drawn by the pane.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.AppointmentsCoverPane.KeepTimesAtDropProperty
member.summary: The KeepTimesAtDrop attached property determines the behavior of moved (dragged) appointments. If this value is True, after dragging an appointment to the desired VisualInterval, the Appointment start date is changed to the VisualInterval start date. If this value is False, the Appointment.Start becomes equal to the VisualInterval.StartTime, and Appointment.Duration becomes equal to the VisualInterval.TimeScale. The default value is False.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.SelectedEnumMemberConverter
member.summary: Represents a Binding converter that indicates whether a binding source value is an enum member specified in the converter parameter.
member.remarks:
is a two-way converter.
Source - Target behavior:
If a binding source value is an enum member specified in a converter parameter, then the binding target value is True; otherwise, False.
Target - Source behavior:
If target is True, then the source is the enum member specified in a parameter. Otherwise, the source is not updated.

Source - Target behavior:
Returns True if a source value is one of the enum members listed in a parameter; otherwise, False.
Target - Source behavior:

member.remarks: is a two-way converter. A back conversion is performed via the DateTime.DateTime.TryParseExact method if converter parameter is specified; otherwise, the DateTime.DateTime.TryParse method is used.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.ReminderDueInMultiConverter
member.summary: Represents a MultiBinding converter that provides a value for the 'Due in' column of the Reminders dialog box.
member.remarks:
is a one-way converter. It takes as a source a list of two values - the first one is a DateTime when event will occur, and the second one is a current DateTime - and returns a string with a phrase that describes how much time stays until the event. If the second source value is not specified then the DateTime.Now value is used.
The standard Reminders dialog box uses this converter in conjunction with the object whose property provides a value for the second source value of the converter.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.ImportanceEnumMemberConverter
member.summary: Represents a Binding converter that indicates whether a binding source value is an enum member specified in the converter parameter.
member.remarks:
is a two-way converter.
Source - Target behavior:
If a binding source value is an enum member specified in a converter parameter, then a binding target value is True; otherwise, False.
Target - Source behavior:
If target is True, then the source is an enum member specified in a parameter. If target is False and parameter is or , then source is .

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.SizingType
member.summary: Describes how UI element is sized with respect to the available space.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.SizingType.Fixed
member.summary: The element size is fixed.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.SizingType.Proportional
member.summary: Element size depends on available space. Every element has the same size which is determined so that all elements fit into available space.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Schedule.SizingType.ExtendedSingle
member.summary: If element has no intersection with other elements, it will occupy all available space. If there are 2 or more intersecting elements, they all will have fixed size.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.CoverElementsPane.ChunkBreakingAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the breaking angle for painted UI elements.
member.remarks: The lays out UI elements over the arbitrary UI. If the layout direction is changed by an angle greater than what is specified in the property, then painted UI element will be broken into pieces.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.CoverElementsPane.ExtendOnOverflow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, specifying the behavior in the case when covering elements do not fit into the available space. If False, the will be set to True. This is default behavior. If True, the covered element will be extended in order to accommodate all covering elements.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.CoverElementsPane.CoverElementsMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, determining margins of the cover elements.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Schedule.CoverElementsPane.CoverElementsSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, determining the size of the cover elements. This is dependency property.
member.remarks: This property value determines either height or width of the cover elements depending on the Orientation property value. For horizontal orientation this property determines element height, and for vertical orientation it determines element width. Note, this property only makes sense if property value is SizingType.Fixed or SizingType.ExtendedSingle.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.PropertyBridge
member.summary: Represents a with an arbitrary type of synchronized properties.
member.remarks: See the description for details.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Schedule.PropertyBridge.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes the new instance of the class.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Schedule.PropertyBridge`1
member.summary: Represents a class that exposes two dependency properties and keeps their values equal.
member.typeparam: Defines a type of exposed dependency properties.
member.remarks:
For a usage in XAML appeal to the non-generic class derived from the , for example use the class.
exposes two dependency properties, and , and keeps these property values equal, that is when a value of one property is being changed then the other property is being set to the same value. This simple behavior allows you to use non-DependencyProperty properties along with WPF mechanisms that are designed to work with DependencyProperty-only properties.
The behavioral difference between the and properties lies in the fact that after an initialization of XAML tree where the element is included, the property value is initialized with the property value in all other respects the behavior of these properties is equivalent.
Note that if you need to use as a standalone object in run-time, that is without including it in a XAML tree, you need to call its BeginInit and EndInit methods only after this action will start property value synchronization.
The useful examples of the class usage are:
Binding between two non-dependency properties.
Assign the property with a TwoWay binding having one non-dependency property as a source, and the property with a TwoWay binding having another non-dependency property as a source. After this, the non-dependency properties will behave as bound ones. This only works well if classes exposing the mentioned non-dependency properties implement the interface.
Setting a non-dependency property value from within a Trigger.
Assign the property with a TwoWay or OneWayToSource binding having one non-dependency property as a source, and by specifying a Trigger's Setter set a value to the property of this value will be assigned to the non-dependency property which is bound to .
Many-to-many binding.
Assign the and with MultiBinding bindings you will get the many-to-many binding.
Assign value to a nested property.
Set up the property with a TwoWay or OneWayToSource binding where Binding.Path references a nested property, then assign the property (directly or from within a Setter) with a value - as a result the nested property will be assigned to this value.
Assign a property of an object that is not accessible directly.
Similar to the way explained in the previous item, and using Binding.RelativeSource in a binding to the property, you may assign a property value of an element that can't be referenced directly in XAML, for example TemplatedParent or some parent element in visual tree.
The class is derived from the class and, in order to work properly, should be placed somewhere in the visual tree among elements that it should communicate with. The derivation from the class is intentional; it allows the to be part of a visual tree, which in turn provides bindings established on its properties with a correct context.
The property of the element is set to Collapsed by default, so this object will not appear on a screen and doesn't participate in layout measurement and arrangement processes, that is, it doesn't affect a visual representation of the visual tree where it placed in.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1
member.summary: Represents a collection of mappings for properties of the object to the appropriate data fields. Names of properties are keys in this collection.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects for mapping. It should be derived from the class and have the default parameter-less constructor.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1.IdMapping
member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.BaseStorage`2
member.summary: The is the base generic component for all storages in C1Schedule object model. Represents a storage of objects derived from . This component implements methods of operations over the collections of objects. It allows the collection to be populated programmatically or automatically by retrieving data from the data source which is specified by the DataSource and DataMember properties. It allows mapping of data source fields to the object properties.

member.name: F:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrenceStateEnum.NotRecurring
member.summary: Represents a standard (non-recurring) appointment.

member.name: F:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrenceStateEnum.Master
member.summary: Represents the appointment which serves as the pattern for the other recurring appointments. The pattern for recurring appointments is specified via the Appointment.Recurrence property.

member.name: F:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrenceStateEnum.Occurrence
member.summary: Represents one of recurring appointments whose pattern appointment is specified via the Appointment.Recurrence property.

member.name: F:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrenceStateEnum.Exception
member.summary: Represents a recurring appointment, which was changed and now doesn't satisfy the pattern of the recurring series.

member.name: F:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrenceStateEnum.Removed
member.summary: Represents a recurring appointment, which was deleted and now doesn't satisfy the pattern of the recurring series.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Action
member.summary: Gets an object for the object. Once this property is first requested, a new object is created and assigned to the property.
member.remarks: The object contains information regarding the type of action to perform as well as the command and parameters to pass to the action. If the action object is enabled, the action will be invoked when the start date and time of the owning object has occurred.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Importance
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the relative importance level for the appointment. Default value is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AllDayEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the current appointment is an All-day appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom information associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is valid only for the lifetime of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.CustomData
member.summary: Gets or sets custom text associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is serialized with other appointment properties. It isn't used by the scheduler, use it to keep your data associated with appointment. This property is serialized into different formats and it is saved into underlying data source if mapping for Appointment Properties is set.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AppointmentType
member.summary: Gets or sets custom text value associated with this object.

remarks.para: This property is serialized with other appointment properties. You can use this property to show customized content or perform different actions depending on the property value. This property is serialized into different formats and it is saved into underlying data source if mapping for Appointment Properties is set.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Saved
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment has not been modified since the last save.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the sensitivity level of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Private
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining whether the calendar owner intends to keep the object private.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the subject of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the body of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Conflicts
member.summary: Gets the object representing the list of objects which are in conflict with this particular appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AutoResolvedWinner
member.summary: Gets the value determining if the item is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution.
member.remarks: A value of false does not necessarily indicate that the item is a loser of an automatic conflict resolution. The item should be in conflict with another item. If an item has its Conflicts.Count property greater than zero and if its property is true, it is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. On the other hand, if the item is in conflict and has its property as false, it is a loser in an automatic conflict resolution.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the start date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: If the property is set to true, then the start date of the appointment is the of the , and the start time of the appointment is 0:00.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the end date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: The property is usually specified by the and properties, and is always calculated as = + . When setting the property, the property retains its value, and the is changed according to the new value of the property. If the new property's value is less than the property's value, then an exception will be raised.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, or value is equal to the value of property, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsOneDay
member.summary: Gets a value indicating either it is a one day appointment or shares some days.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of the appointment.
member.remarks: At setting this property, if it's value is not equal to the whole number of days, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying where the appointment is going to be.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Reminder
member.summary: Gets the object which is associated with the appointment. To associate an appointment with the reminder, set its property to true. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether a reminder is associated with the appointment. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderTimeBeforeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the interval of time the reminder should occur prior to the start of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderOverrideDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the associated object has non-default settings. True if the reminder overrides the default reminder behavior for the appointment. You must set the property to validate the and the properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderPlaySound
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the reminder should play a sound when it occurs for this appointment or task. The property must be set in order to validate the property. This property is only valid if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSoundFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the path and file name of the sound file to play when the reminder occurs for the appointment. This property is only valid if the and properties are set to true.
member.remarks: The default sound is the system Exclamation sound.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsRecurring
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment is recurring.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ParentRecurrence
member.summary: Gets the object that defines the recurrence criteria for this object. If this appointment is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root appointment, null is returned.
member.remarks: If an appointment is recurring (see the property) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern appointment. Use the property to obtain the pattern of the current appointment. A pattern appointment can be recognized by its property set to the value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern appointment can be accessed via the property of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.RecurrenceState
member.summary: Gets the value indicating the recurrence state of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the object associated with this appointment.
member.remarks: Labels may be associated with an appointment to effectively group appointments.
This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.LabelStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Resources
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of objects for this appointment. An appointment may be associated with multiple resources.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.ResourceStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Links
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of objects for this appointment. An appointment may be associated with multiple contacts.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.ContactStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BusyStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the object indicating the busy status of the user for the appointment.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.StatusStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Categories
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of categories assigned to the appointment. Categories may be associated with an appointment to effectively group appointments. An appointment may be associated with multiple categories.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.CategoryStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the object which owns current object.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.OwnerStorage storage.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BeginEdit
member.summary: Prevents the object from being updated until the method is called.
member.remarks: The and methods are designed to implement batch modifications. This allows you to prevent generation of change notifications when changing multiple settings at the same time. To do this enclose the code that changes the properties in calls to these methods. Each call to must be paired with a call to . To ensure that is always called even if an exception occurs, wrap any calls to these methods in a try...finally statement.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.EndEdit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unlocks the object after a call to the method and causes an immediate update.
member.param: The value determining if change notifications can be generated when applying changes.

remarks.para: Set includeKeys to true if you want to receive exact copy of the specified object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.BasePersistableObject.Key
member.summary: Gets an array of objects representing the key of the .

remarks.para: In the current version, the array always contains a single object. It can be either an or value depending on which one is actually used for binding this data. For example, if you bind AppointmentStorage to the database and set IndexMapping, this property will return an value. If you set IdMapping, this property will return a value.
In future versions working with compound keys might be implemented. In such case this property will return array of objects composing the key.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.CalendarInfo.DateTimeKind
member.summary: Gets or sets specifying DateTime kind used for saving values.
member.remarks: This property only have an influence on the process of saving data to the AppointmentStorage.DataSource object and on export operations. All properties of the and objects represent current system local time values. Set this property to DateTimeLind.Utc if you need to save data with universal time. In such case the data will be converted to the local time and back at every read/write operation.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.RecurrenceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the type of recurrence (daily, monthly, etc.). Default value is RecurrenceTypeEnum.Weekly.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The property works in conjunction with the property to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the is set to , and the is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of each occurrence in the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end date of the recurrence pattern.
member.remarks: This property is optional but must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If this property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite, and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true. The property must be set before setting .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This property allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Get or sets the value specifying the count for which the recurrence pattern is valid for a given interval. This property is only valid for recurrences of the and types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is WeekOfMonthEnum.First.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the mask for week days on which the recurring appointment occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the . The default value is 0.
member.remarks: When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property cannot be set to ; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the property is set to or the property is not applicable.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This property is only valid for recurrence patterns whose property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.summary: Gets the object which holds the list of objects removed from that series of appointments.
